name: Use Helvetica Dangit
author: Soma Design

sections.description:
WordPress 3.2 uses Arial in the admin, marring an otherwise beautiful design. Use Helvetica instead instead of its bastard offspring.

WordPress 3.2.1 introduced a patch that uses the sans-serif keyword. This plugin is thankfully no longer necessary.
sections.faq:
Will this plugin remove Arial from the WordPress admin area?

Yes. It’s no longer there to remove. Unless you’re on Windows, but a WordPress plugin can’t fix that for you.

Can you also remove the scourge of Arial from the rest of the Internet?

If only I could. Be the change you want to see in the world.

I don’t see the plugin listed

If you’re on a Multisite Network, activate this plugin across the network in the Network admin area so that all of your users can bask in the glow of improved typography.
sections.changelog:
1.0.1

  • Make plugin useless, as Arial is blessedly gone in WP 3.2.1

1.0

  • Initial release.

short_description: Nobody should have to look at Arial.
